items.title: Adani Port Q2 Results: Cons net profit rises 27% YoY to Rs 3,109 crore, revenue jumps 30%
items.description: Adani Port Q2 Results: Adani Ports has announced strong financial results for the second quarter ending September 2025. The company's consolidated net profit saw a significant jump of 27 percent year-on-year. Revenue from operations also climbed by nearly 30 percent compared to the same period last year. These figures highlight robust growth for Adani Ports.

items.title: Suzlon Energy Q2 Results: PAT soars 538% YoY to Rs 1,279 crore, highest in 30 years; revenue jumps 85%
items.description: Suzlon Energy Q2 Results: Suzlon Energy achieved a record profit in the second quarter of FY26. Profit After Tax surged 538 percent year-on-year. Revenue from operations also rose 85 percent. This strong performance was driven by the wind turbine generator segment and increased deliveries. The company's orderbook crossed 6 GW, highlighting its robust market position and future growth prospects.

items.title: IndiGo Q2 Results: Airline back in red, posts loss of Rs 2,582 crore on currency depreciation
items.description: IndiGo Q2 Results: Aviation major IndiGo slipped into a loss of Rs 2,582 crore in the September quarter as against a profit of Rs 2,176 crore in the preceding June quarter. However, when compared with the year-ago period, the airline's loss widened from Rs 987 crore.

items.title: Adani Enterprises Q2 Results: Cons profit soars 84% YoY to Rs 3,199 crore despite 6% drop in revenue
items.description: Adani Enterprises Q2 Results: ​​Adani Enterprises reported an 84% surge in Q2 net profit to Rs 3,199 crore, driven by exceptional gains from stake sales in Adani Wilmar. Despite a 6% dip in revenue to Rs 21,249 crore, the company's PAT jumped significantly sequentially. The board also approved a Rs 25,000 crore rights issue.

items.title: Sun Pharma Q2 Preview: PAT may rise 2% YoY; Leqselvi spending to weigh on margins
items.description: Sun Pharma is expected to report modest Q2 FY26 earnings growth, with PAT likely up 2% YoY and revenue rising 7%. Analysts cite Leqselvi launch costs, weak Taro performance, and high R&D spend as margin drags, even as domestic and specialty segments continue to drive overall growth.

items.title: SBI Q2 Results: Standalone profit jumps 10% YoY to Rs 20,160 crore, beats Street estimates
items.description: SBI Q2 Results:  State Bank of India (SBI) reported a 10% year-on-year rise in standalone Q2 net profit to Rs 20,160 crore, beating Street estimates. Brokerages had expected up to a 17% decline, but higher interest income of Rs 1,19,654 crore, up 5% YoY, helped offset pressures, showcasing resilience in the lender’s core operations.

items.title: M&M Q2 Results: PAT surges 28% YoY to Rs 3,673 crore, revenue jumps 22%
items.description: Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) reported a strong Q2FY26 performance, with consolidated PAT up 28% YoY to ₹3,673 crore and revenue rising 21.7%. The automaker maintained leadership across SUVs, tractors, and electric 3-wheelers, while its finance and tech subsidiaries delivered robust margin and profit growth.
